AudioWorkletGlobalScope.summary: The AudioWorkletGlobalScope interface of the Web Audio API represents a global execution context for user-supplied code, which defines custom -derived classes.

remarks.para: Each has a single available under the property, which runs its code in a single AudioWorkletGlobalScope.

As the global execution context is shared across the current BaseAudioContext, it's possible to define any other variables and perform any actions allowed in worklets â€” apart from defining AudioWorkletProcessor derived classes.

-Web Audio API
-Using the Web Audio API
-Using AudioWorklet

AudioWorkletGlobalScopeCurrentFrame.summary: The read-only currentFrame property of the interface returns an integer that represents the ever-increasing current sample-frame of the audio block being processed. It is incremented by 128 (the size of a render quantum) after the processing of each audio block.

remarks.para:
-Web Audio API
-Using the Web Audio API

AudioWorkletGlobalScopeCurrentTime.summary: The read-only currentTime property of the interface returns a double that represents the ever-increasing context time of the audio block being processed. It is equal to the property of the the worklet belongs to.

remarks.para:
-Web Audio API
-Using the Web Audio API

AudioWorkletGlobalScopeCurrentTime.value: A floating-point number representing the time.

AudioWorkletGlobalScopePort.summary: NOTE Experimental The port read-only property of the interface returns a object that can be used to send and receive messages between the main thread and the associated .

remarks.para: This allows for custom, asynchronous communication between code in the main thread and the global scope of an audio worklet, such as sending control data or global settings.

-Web Audio API
-Using the Web Audio API
-Using AudioWorklet

AudioWorkletGlobalScopePort.value: The object that is connecting the AudioWorklet and its associated AudioWorkletGlobalScope.

AudioWorkletGlobalScopeRegisterProcessor.summary:
The registerProcessor method of the
interface registers a class constructor derived
from interface under a specified name.

AudioWorkletGlobalScopeSampleRate.summary: The read-only sampleRate property of the interface returns a float that represents the sample rate of the associated the worklet belongs to.

remarks.para:
-Web Audio API
-Using the Web Audio API

AudioWorkletGlobalScopeSampleRate.value: A floating-point number representing the associated sample rate.
